uuid.title: uuid
uuid.description: Unique identifier for layer that is globally unique.

dc_identifier_s.description: Unique identifier for layer. May be same as UUID but may be an alternate identifier.
dc_identifier_s.title: dc_identifier_s

dct_references_s.description: JSON hash for external resources, where each key is a URI for the protocol or format and the value is the URL to the resource.
dct_references_s.title: dct_references_s

georss_box_s.description: Bounding box as maximum values for S W N E. Example: 12.6 -119.4 19.9 84.8
georss_box_s.title: georss_box_s

layer_id_s.description: The complete identifier for the layer via WMS/WFS/WCS protocol. Example: druid:vr593vj7147
layer_id_s.title: layer_id_s

layer_geom_type_s.description: Geometry type for layer data, using controlled vocabulary.
layer_geom_type_s.title: layer_geom_type_s

layer_modified_dt.description: Last modification date for the metadata record, using XML Schema dateTime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ).
layer_modified_dt.title: layer_modified_dt

layer_slug_s.description: Unique identifier visible to the user, used for Permalinks. Example: stanford-vr593vj7147
layer_slug_s.title: layer_slug_s

solr_geom.description: Derived from georss_polygon_s or georss_box_s. Shape of the layer as a ENVELOPE WKT using W E N S. Note that this field is indexed as a Solr spatial (RPT) field. Example: ENVELOPE(76.76, 84.76, 19.91, 12.62)
solr_geom.title: solr_geom

solr_year_i.description: Derived from dct_temporal_sm. Year for which layer is valid and only a single value. Note that this field is indexed as a Solr numeric field. Example: 1989
solr_year_i.title: solr_year_i

dc_creator_sm.title: dc_creator_sm
dc_creator_sm.description: Author(s). Example: George Washington, Thomas Jefferson

dc_format_s.description: File format for the layer, using a controlled vocabulary.
dc_format_s.title: dc_format_s

dc_language_s.description: Language for the layer. Example: English.
dc_language_s.title: dc_language_s

dc_subject_sm.description: Subjects, preferrably in a controlled vocabulary. Examples: Census, Human settlements.
dc_subject_sm.title: dc_subject_sm

dc_type_s.description: Resource type, using DCMI Type Vocabulary.
dc_type_s.title: dc_type_s

dct_spatial_sm.description: Spatial coverage and place names, preferrably in a controlled vocabulary. Example: 'Paris, France'.
dct_spatial_sm.title: dct_spatial_sm

dct_temporal_sm.description: Temporal coverage, typically years or dates. Example: 1989, circa 2010, 2007-2009. Note that this field is not in a specific date format.
dct_temporal_sm.title: dct_temporal_sm

dct_issued_dt.description: Issued date for the layer, using XML Schema dateTime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ).
dct_issued_dt.title: dct_issued_dt

dct_isPartOf_sm.description: Holding dataset for the layer, such as the name of a collection. Example: Village Maps of India.
dct_isPartOf_sm.title: dct_isPartOf_sm

georss_point_s.description: Point representation for layer as y, x - i.e., centroid. Example: 12.6 -119.4.
georss_point_s.title: georss_point_s
